availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Gregory (Union County and Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Sallie "Sarah" F. Waggener Gregory in Adair County, Kentucky, on October 19, 1827. Father of Charles Gregory, M. A. Gregory, O. G. Gregory, Richard Gregory, Robert Gregory, Pauline Gregory, Rebecca Gregory, and Virginia Gregory. Farmer in Union County in 1850. Employed F. Bishop as a laborer in Union County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 515A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 333.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 752.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 216A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Caseyville, p. 1.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, Film #000469189, p. 77.
